security: Disclosing the estimated completion date of a Privacy Act case could potentially reveal the CIA's internal processes and timelines for handling such matters. This may allow individuals or organizations to anticipate and potentially circumvent CIA responses to similar requests, hindering the agency's ability to protect sensitive information.
summary: A speed letter from A. F. Addona (DDO/PIC) to Walter Lloyd (Office of General Counsel) providing an estimated completion date of 20 August 1976 for Privacy Act case 71-728 concerning Werbell.
summary_one_paragraph: This speed letter, dated August 6, 1976, is from A. F. Addona of DDO/PIC to Walter Lloyd in the Office of General Counsel, addressing the status of Privacy Act case 71-728 related to Werbell. Addona informs Lloyd that DDO/PIC estimates the case will be completed by August 20, 1976, and provides contact information for Hal Matter (S/TIC) or himself for further inquiries.
title: Privacy Act Case 71-728--Werbell
